column2: ENTREES
column3: ENTREES

column2: Sweetbreads with Mushrooms
column3: Sweetbreads with Mushrooms

column2: Lay half a dozen sweetbreads in cold water for twelve hours, changing the water several times.
column3: Lay half a dozen sweetbreads in cold water for twelve hours, changing the water several times.

column2: Then boil them five minutes, drop into cold water, remove the skin and lard with fat bacon.
column3: Then boil them five minutes, drop into cold water, remove the skin and lard with fat bacon.

column2: Put them in a saucepan with a pint of stock, two small onions and one carrot chopped, a teaspoonful of minced parsley, salt, pepper, cayenne, and a little mace.
column3: Put them in a saucepan with a pint of stock, two small onions and one carrot chopped, a teaspoonful of minced parsley, salt, pepper, cayenne, and a little mace.

column2: Stew until tender.
column3: Stew until tender.

column2: Serve with a mushroom sauce, made as follows: Take a small bottle of mushrooms or one dozen fresh mushrooms sliced and boil them five minutes in water and lime juice.
column3: Serve with a mushroom sauce, made as follows: Take a small bottle of mushrooms or one dozen fresh mushrooms sliced and boil them five minutes in water and lime juice.

column2: Drain and place in a stew pan with two ounces of butter, one ounce of flour and a pint of well seasoned stock or gravy.
column3: Drain and place in a stew pan with two ounces of butter, one ounce of flour and a pint of well seasoned stock or gravy.

column2: Cook until the sauce is reduced one-half.
column3: Cook until the sauce is reduced one half.

column2: Pour over the hot sweetbreads.
column3: Pour over the hot sweetbreads.

column2: Terrapin
column3: Terrapin

column2: Boil the terrapin for one hour, and clean carefully.
column3: Boil the terrapin for one hour, and clean carefully.

column2: Rub into a paste the yolks of six hard-boiled eggs, half the white of one egg chopped, one tablespoonful of butter, one teaspoonful of flour, three whole cloves, salt, pepper, cayenne and mace.
column3: Rub into a paste the yolks of six hard boiled eggs, half the white of one egg chopped, one tablespoonful of butter, one teaspoonful of flour, three whole cloves, salt, pepper, cayenne and mace.

column2: Cook slowly for twenty minutes.
column3: Cook slowly for twenty minutes.

column2: Add three glasses of sherry and madeira and allow it to boil once, when it is ready to serve.
column3: Add three glasses of sherry and madeira and allow it to boil once, when it is ready to serve.

column2: Frogs a la Poulette
column3: Frogs a la Poulette

column2: Joint the hind legs and backs of twelve frogs; put in a closely covered saucepan with some truffles, a small can of mushrooms sliced, a glass of white wine, salt, white pepper, cayenne, mace and four ounces of butter.
column3: Joint the hind legs and backs of twelve frogs; put in a closely covered saucepan with some truffles, a small can of mushrooms sliced, a glass of white wine, salt, white pepper, cayenne, mace and four ounces of butter.

column2: Stew gently fifteen minutes, stirring once or twice. If then tender, add one teaspoonful cornstarch rubbed into one ounce of butter.
column3: Stew gently fifteen minutes, stirring once or twice. If then tender, add one teaspoonful cornstarch rubbed into one ounce of butter.

column2: Let it cook two minutes, take from the fire and stir in the yolks of six eggs beaten well with one-half cup of cream.
column3: Let it cook two minutes, take from the fire and stir in the yolks of six eggs beaten well with one half cup of cream.

column2: Place this mixture where it will keep hot without cooking.
column3: Place this mixture where it will keep hot without cooking.

column2: Cut the crust from a loaf of bread, scoop out the center, brush with butter and brown in the oven.
column3: Cut the crust from a loaf of bread, scoop out the center, brush with butter and brown in the oven.

column2: Pour the frogs legs and sauce into the bread cup, garnish with mushrooms and truffles.
column3: Pour the frogs legs and sauce into the bread cup, garnish with mushrooms and truffles.

column2: Simmer a calves' head for two hours.
column3: Simmer a calves' head for two hours.

column2: Tie the brains in a cloth, put them in the saucepan with the head and cook two hours longer.
column3: Tie the brains in a cloth, put them in the saucepan with the head and cook two hours longer.

column2: Then extract the bones and cut the meat in pieces, return it to the saucepan without the brains, adding two ounces of butter, two dozen stoned olives, one dozen cloves, salt, pepper, cayenne, and a cup of white wine.
column3: Then extract the bones and cut the meat in pieces, return it to the saucepan without the brains, adding two ounces of butter, two dozen stoned olives, one dozen cloves, salt, pepper, cayenne, and a cup of white wine.

column2: Cook for one hour, then add the brains cut in bits, the shaved peel and piece of one lemon and three hard-boiled eggs sliced. Cook thirty minutes.
column3: Cook for one hour, then add the brains cut in bits, the shaved peel and piece of one lemon and three hard boiled eggs sliced. Cook thirty minutes.

column2: Thicken the sauce with flour rubbed into butter and serve with the calves' head.
column3: Thicken the sauce with flour rubbed into butter and serve with the calves' head.

column2: Trim twelve lamb chops very closely and fry lightly in six ounces of butter.
column3: Trim twelve lamb chops very closely and fry lightly in six ounces of butter.

column2: Remove them and in the same butter place two onions, sliced, four green peppers minced, one can of mushrooms minced, and two stalks of celery chopped; salt, pepper, cayenne, and the juice of a lime. Cook until these ingredients are soft.
column3: Remove them and in the same butter place two onions, sliced, four green peppers minced, one can of mushrooms minced, and two stalks of celery chopped; salt, pepper, cayenne, and the juice of a lime. Cook until these ingredients are soft.

column2: Stir in six ounces of flour. Then add two cups of milk and cook until the mixture is thick and smooth.
column3: Stir in six ounces of flour. Then add two cups of milk and cook until the mixture is thick and smooth.

column2: Dust a plate with cracker crumbs and on this place a spoonful of the fried mixture.
column3: Dust a plate with cracker crumbs and on this place a spoonful of the fried mixture.

column2: Place a chop on top of this, cover it with another spoonful of the mixture and dust with cracker crumbs.
column3: Place a chop on top of this, cover it with another spoonful of the mixture and dust with cracker crumbs.

column2: Repeat with each chop, and when cold roll each in beaten egg and cracker crumbs, and fry a light brown.
column3: Repeat with each chop, and when cold roll each in beaten egg and cracker crumbs, and fry a light brown.

column2: Boil four calves' feet until tender.
column3: Boil four calves' feet until tender.

column2: Then remove from the fire and beat in the yolks of two eggs which have been mixed with the juice of a lime and a tablespoonful of water.
column3: Then remove from the fire and beat in the yolks of two eggs which have been mixed with the juice of a lime and a tablespoonful of water.

column2: When cold cut into slices, brush with egg and bread crumbs and fry in butter until a light brown.
column3: When cold cut into slices, brush with egg and bread crumbs and fry in butter until a light brown.

column2: Puree of Chestnuts with Chops
column3: Puree of Chestnuts with Chops

column2: Boil chestnuts in salted water for twenty minutes.
column3: Boil chestnuts in salted water for twenty minutes.

column2: Shell them, season with salt and pepper, add a piece of butter and wet with milk.
column3: Shell them, season with salt and pepper, add a piece of butter and wet with milk.

column2: Mash through a colander and heap lightly on a platter, arranging broiled chops around the puree.
column3: Mash through a colander and heap lightly on a platter, arranging broiled chops around the puree.

column2: Lamb Chops a la Nesselrode
column3: Lamb Chops a la Nesselrode

column2: Trim carefully one dozen young lamb chops.
column3: Trim carefully one dozen young lamb chops.

column2: Then add a glass of sherry and stir it well before adding also a cup of rice, four cups of stock, several sweet Chili peppers chopped and some salt.
column3: Then add a glass of sherry and stir it well before adding also a cup of rice, four cups of stock, several sweet Chili peppers chopped and some salt.

column2: Cook for half an hour or until pasty.
column3: Cook for half an hour or until pasty.

column2: Then with a biscuit cutter, cut it into rounds about the size of a chop.
column3: Then with a biscuit cutter, cut it into rounds about the size of a chop.

column2: On each one of these rounds place a chop and cover the top with Bechamel sauce.
column3: On each one of these rounds place a chop and cover the top with Bechamel sauce.

column2: When cold dip in egg and bread crumbs and fry a light brown.
column3: When cold dip in egg and bread crumbs and fry a light brown.

column2: A good recipe for the Bechamel sauce is the following: One ounce of butter browned with one ounce of flour.
column3: A good recipe for the Bechamel sauce is the following: One ounce of butter browned with one ounce of flour.

column2: To this add half a glass of sherry, some finely chopped truffles, one cup and a half of stock, salt and pepper, and cook for ten minutes.
column3: To this add half a glass of sherry, some finely chopped truffles, one cup and a half of stock, salt and pepper, and cook for ten minutes.

column2: Add the juice of a lime, take from the fire and stir in the well-beaten yolks of two eggs.
column3: Add the juice of a lime, take from the fire and stir in the well beaten yolks of two eggs.

column2: Devil Chops
column3: Devil Chops

column2: Make a dressing of the following ingredients mixed together: One ounce of butter, one teaspoonful of made mustard, one-half teaspoonful of French mustard, one teaspoonful of grated horseradish, one teaspoonful of chutney, a little Chili vinegar, the juice of one lime, salt, pepper and cayenne.
column3: Make a dressing of the following ingredients mixed together: One ounce of butter, one teaspoonful of made mustard, one half teaspoonful of French mustard, one teaspoonful of grated horseradish, one teaspoonful of chutney, a little Chili vinegar, the juice of one lime, salt, pepper and cayenne.

column2: Rub this on the chops and broil rare.
column3: Rub this on the chops and broil rare.

column2: Serve the remaining sauce over them in a very hot dish.
column3: Serve the remaining sauce over them in a very hot dish.

column2: Fry one dozen lamb chops in butter and set aside to cool.
column3: Fry one dozen lamb chops in butter and set aside to cool.

column2: Put in a stew pan two ounces of butter with half a can of mushrooms, one small onion and a teaspoonful of parsley, all minced fine; salt, pepper, cayenne and a little mace.
column3: Put in a stew pan two ounces of butter with half a can of mushrooms, one small onion and a teaspoonful of parsley, all minced fine; salt, pepper, cayenne and a little mace.

column2: Cook this gently for ten minutes and add a cup of milk thickened with flour and butter, the juice of a lemon and one teaspoonful of sugar.
column3: Cook this gently for ten minutes and add a cup of milk thickened with flour and butter, the juice of a lemon and one teaspoonful of sugar.

column2: Cook a few minutes.
column3: Cook a few minutes.

column2: Take from the fire and add the yolks of four eggs well beaten.
column3: Take from the fire and add the yolks of four eggs well beaten.

column2: Cover the chops with this and set aside to cool.
column3: Cover the chops with this and set aside to cool.

column2: Brush them with the well-beaten yolk of an egg, sprinkle with fine bread crumbs, and fry in butter to a light brown. Serve with green peas in the center of the dish.
column3: Brush them with the well beaten yolk of an egg, sprinkle with fine bread crumbs, and fry in butter to a light brown. Serve with green peas in the center of the dish.

column2: Lamb Cutlets a la Condi
column3: Lamb Cutlets a la Condi

column2: Lard lamb cutlets with strips of truffle, anchovy and gherkin.
column3: Lard lamb cutlets with strips of truffle, anchovy and gherkin.

column2: Put this on each side of the cutlets and cover with crepinette.
column3: Put this on each side of the cutlets and cover with crepinette.

column2: Serve with a browned veal gravy and sliced lemon.
column3: Serve with a browned veal gravy and sliced lemon.

column2: Eggs with Tomatoes
column3: Eggs with Tomatoes

column2: Fry in two ounces of butter two small dry onions and two green peppers, chopped.
column3: Fry in two ounces of butter two small dry onions and two green peppers, chopped.

column2: Add half a dozen tomatoes peeled and cut up, salt and pepper.
column3: Add half a dozen tomatoes peeled and cut up, salt and pepper.

column2: Simmer fifteen minutes.
column3: Simmer fifteen minutes.

column2: Add the corn cut from half a dozen ears, and cook fifteen minutes longer.
column3: Add the corn cut from half a dozen ears, and cook fifteen minutes longer.

column2: Pour the mixture into a baking dish, and break over it six eggs.
column3: Pour the mixture into a baking dish, and break over it six eggs.

column2: Place in the oven until set.
column3: Place in the oven until set.

column2: Macaroni a la Rossini
column3: Macaroni a la Rossini

column2: Cook a pint or less of macaroni in well salted water; drain and put into a stew pan, with a little good gravy.
column3: Cook a pint or less of macaroni in well salted water; drain and put into a stew pan, with a little good gravy.

column2: Simmer very slowly until the gravy is all absorbed, shaking the pan occasionally.
column3: Simmer very slowly until the gravy is all absorbed, shaking the pan occasionally.

column2: Put a layer of the macaroni in a baking dish, sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and sliced truffles mixed with a little good sauce espagnole.
column3: Put a layer of the macaroni in a baking dish, sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and sliced truffles mixed with a little good sauce espagnole.

column2: Fill the dish and on the top layer put truffles.
column3: Fill the dish and on the top layer put truffles.

column2: Place in the oven a few minutes and serve with grated Parmesan cheese on a separate dish.
column3: Place in the oven a few minutes and serve with grated Parmesan cheese on a separate dish.

column2: Timbale of Macaroni for Twelve Persons
column3: Timbale of Macaroni for Twelve Persons

column2: Boil one-half pound of macaroni in water for five minutes.
column3: Boil one half pound of macaroni in water for five minutes.

column2: Cut in inch length pieces and simmer for twenty minutes in one quart of milk, being careful that it does not boil.
column3: Cut in inch length pieces and simmer for twenty minutes in one quart of milk, being careful that it does not boil.

column2: Season with salt, pepper, mace and cayenne.
column3: Season with salt, pepper, mace and cayenne.

column2: Add one cup of cream, stir until very smooth, add the beaten yolks of eight eggs and one can of mushrooms sliced.
column3: Add one cup of cream, stir until very smooth, add the beaten yolks of eight eggs and one can of mushrooms sliced.

column2: Stir well and then add the macaroni with one pound of sweetbreads, cut in small pieces and two dozen Eastern oysters.
column3: Stir well and then add the macaroni with one pound of sweetbreads, cut in small pieces and two dozen Eastern oysters.
